    Updating to 3.65

    If you like the guide, please consider donating via PayPal.

    If you have any issues or problems, read the FAQ or ask on our Discord Server.

    This will update your PS Vita to system version 3.65 in preparation for the new HENkaku exploit. The exploit only runs on 3.65 and above, so you’ll need to update to that before you can proceed.

    Do not update through the system to 3.68. You cannot install HENkaku Ensō on system versions 3.67 and above. HENkaku Ensō allows you to run homebrew automatically on boot.

    This guide is for updating to STOCK 3.65. If you are looking to update to HENkaku Ensō 3.65 from 3.60, follow this guide.

    This guide is not compatible with PS TV consoles.

    This guide is untested and may result in a brick.

    Downloads

    • PS Vita Firmware 3.65
    • QCMA
    • psp2-updatelist.xml
      • US
      • EU
      • JP

    Instructions

    1. Install QCMA onto your PC
    2. Copy the PSP2UPDAT.PUP file to your QCMA Updates folder
      • On Windows this is typically C:\Users\USERNAME\Documents\PSV Updates
    3. Copy the psp2-updatelist.xml file to your QCMA Updates folder
    4. On your PS Vita, open the Settings application
    5. Enable “Flight Mode”
    6. Press the PS button to go back to the home screen
    7. Tap the bubble in the top right corner
    8. Delete any updates previously downloaded if they exist
    9. Launch QCMA on your PC
    10. Plug your Vita into your PC via USB
    11. On your Vita, open the Settings application again
    12. Select “System Update”
    13. Select “Update from PC”
    14. Be absolutely certain that the message says “Version 3.65”
      • If it does not, go back and see where you went wrong
    15. Update your system

    Blocking Updates
